header: =1= ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 92/2019 (Dinkar Kondiba Chavan Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000485-2019

background.text: 1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of report dated 15.01.2019 filed by Amol Ramchandra Tarade in C.R.No. 14 of 2019.

legalActFound.stringMatched: under section 438 of criminal procedure code

arguments.text: 2) Accusation is that, complainant owned a house property at village Eksar, Taluka Wai and applicant demolished the same with the help of J.C.B. and committed theft of household articles worth Rs.5,000/­. With this story, the complainant lodged present crime with Wai Police Station for the offence punishable under Sec. 454, 448, 380 and 427 of Indian Penal Code against the applicant

argumentSentences.text: 2) Accusation is that, complainant owned a house property at village Eksar, Taluka Wai and applicant demolished the same with the help of J.C.B. and committed theft of household articles worth Rs.5,000/­.
With this story, the complainant lodged present crime with Wai Police Station for the offence punishable under Sec. 454, 448, 380 and 427 of Indian Penal Code against the applicant

arguments.text: 3) According to accused, he has not committed said offence, the property mentioned in FIR is of Civil nature and there was civil litigation and it was in dilapidated condition since long time. It is further contended that, complainant is seeking right over the property possessed by the applicant and in order to pressurize the complainant, he has filed this criminal complainant against the applicant.

argumentSentences.text: 3) According to accused, he has not committed said offence, the property mentioned in FIR is of Civil nature and there was civil litigation and it was in dilapidated condition since long time.

It is further contended that, complainant is seeking right over the property possessed by the applicant and in order to pressurize the complainant, he has filed this criminal complainant against the applicant.

arguments.text: 4) Advocate for applicant submitted that, offence punishable under Section 454, 380 of I.P.C. does not attract, there was civil litigation between applicant and one Anna Chavan, there was exchange of notices and there is adjudication of civil litigation. It is pointed out that, there is delay of around 4 days in lodging FIR. It is submitted that, applicant is the Manager in O.N.G.C. at Mumbai and he is not involved in alleged crime.

argumentSentences.text: 4) Advocate for applicant submitted that, offence punishable under Section 454, 380 of I.P.C. does not attract, there was civil litigation between applicant and one Anna Chavan, there was exchange of notices and there is adjudication of civil litigation.
It is pointed out that, there is delay of around 4 days in lodging FIR.
It is submitted that, applicant is the Manager in O.N.G.C. at Mumbai and he is not involved in alleged crime.

arguments.text: 5) Learned A.P.P. submitted that, custodial interrogation of accused is necessary and the stolen articles are to be seized.

argumentSentences.text: 5) Learned A.P.P. submitted that, custodial interrogation of accused is necessary and the stolen articles are to be seized.

arguments.text: 6) From the papers it seems that, according to the informant, incident occurred on 11.01.2019, FIR is lodged on 15.01.2019 but on 12.01.2019, applicant himself has made an application to police station informing the police about the civil dispute and initiation of various proceedings by the informant.

argumentSentences.text: 6) From the papers it seems that, according to the informant, incident occurred on 11.01.2019, FIR is lodged on 15.01.2019 but on 12.01.2019, applicant himself has made an application to police station informing the police about the civil dispute and initiation of various proceedings by the informant.

arguments.text: 7) It is submitted that, applicant has not co­operated in investigation. Advocate for applicant submitted the copy of diary in respect of attendance to police station as per earlier order passed by this Court. It was required for police to make interrogation and the attendance was ordered keeping the view that accused will be available for interrogation. If at all the investigation officer has not availed the opportunity, applicant cannot be blamed for the same. Application made by the applicant dated 12.01.2019 is very much speaking about the actual dispute.

argumentSentences.text: 7) It is submitted that, applicant has not co­operated in investigation.
Advocate for applicant submitted the copy of diary in respect of attendance to police station as per earlier order passed by this Court.
It was required for police to make interrogation and the attendance was ordered keeping the view that accused will be available for interrogation.
If at all the investigation officer has not availed the opportunity, applicant cannot be blamed for the same.
Application made by the applicant dated 12.01.2019 is very much speaking about the actual dispute.

arguments.text: 8) Considering all these facts ad­interim anticipatory bail according to applicant may be confirmed. Hence, following order.

argumentSentences.text: 8) Considering all these facts ad­interim anticipatory bail according to applicant may be confirmed.

order.text: ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 92/2019, is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 08.02.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions therein.

footer: (B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 18th March, 2019 Satara
processedText:
=1= ORDER BELOW EXH. 1 IN CRI. MISC. APPLICATION No. 92/2019 (Dinkar Kondiba Chavan Vs. State of Maharashtra) CNR : MHST01-000485-2019 
---header-ends---
1) Present application is filed by the applicant under section 438 of Criminal Procedure Code, 1973 apprehending his arrest as a result of report dated 15.01.2019 filed by Amol Ramchandra Tarade in C.R.No. 14 of 2019. 
---background-ends---
2) Accusation is that, complainant owned a house property at village Eksar, Taluka Wai and applicant demolished the same with the help of J.C.B. and committed theft of household articles worth Rs.5,000/­. With this story, the complainant lodged present crime with Wai Police Station for the offence punishable under Sec. 454, 448, 380 and 427 of Indian Penal Code against the applicant 
---argument-ends---
3) According to accused, he has not committed said offence, the property mentioned in FIR is of Civil nature and there was civil litigation and it was in dilapidated condition since long time. It is further contended that, complainant is seeking right over the property possessed by the applicant and in order to pressurize the complainant, he has filed this criminal complainant against the applicant. 
---argument-ends---
4) Advocate for applicant submitted that, offence punishable under Section 454, 380 of I.P.C. does not attract, there was civil litigation between applicant and one Anna Chavan, there was exchange of notices and there is adjudication of civil litigation. It is pointed out that, there is delay of around 4 days in lodging FIR. It is submitted that, applicant is the Manager in O.N.G.C. at Mumbai and he is not involved in alleged crime. 
---argument-ends---
5) Learned A.P.P. submitted that, custodial interrogation of accused is necessary and the stolen articles are to be seized. 
---argument-ends---
6) From the papers it seems that, according to the informant, incident occurred on 11.01.2019, FIR is lodged on 15.01.2019 but on 12.01.2019, applicant himself has made an application to police station informing the police about the civil dispute and initiation of various proceedings by the informant. 
---argument-ends---
7) It is submitted that, applicant has not co­operated in investigation. Advocate for applicant submitted the copy of diary in respect of attendance to police station as per earlier order passed by this Court. It was required for police to make interrogation and the attendance was ordered keeping the view that accused will be available for interrogation. If at all the investigation officer has not availed the opportunity, applicant cannot be blamed for the same. Application made by the applicant dated 12.01.2019 is very much speaking about the actual dispute. 
---argument-ends---
8) Considering all these facts ad­interim anticipatory bail according to applicant may be confirmed. Hence, following order. 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1) Criminal Bail Application no. 92/2019, is allowed. 2) Interim pre­arrest bail order dated 08.02.2019 passed below Exh. 4, stands confirmed with conditions therein. 
---order-ends---
(B.S.Wavre) Place : Satara Addl. Sessions Judge Date : 18th March, 2019 Satara
